alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Paulding, northeastern Carroll and Douglas Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Treasure Lake, or 10 miles northeast of Carrollton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Douglasville, Villa Rica, Hiram, Winston, Lake Val-Do-Mar, Treasure Lake, Hannah, Brownsville, New Georgia, Bill Arp and Fairplay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
